short_description.en: $1,000 rebate for a ductless heat pump replacing zonal electric resistance as the primary heat source. Primary unit must be in the main living space.
Pacific Power customers are eligible for a $2,000 rebate for a qualifying extended capacity heat pump installed by a trade ally contractor.
$3,000 rebate for an extended capacity heat pump replacing an electric furnace.
$1,000 rebate for an extended capacity central ducted heat pump. Must be listed on Energy Trustâ€™s list and be the primary heat source.
$3,000 rebate for a heat pump for income-qualified customers. Must replace an electric forced-air furnace as the primary heating source.
$1,000 rebate for a heat pump. Must replace an electric forced-air furnace as the primary heat source. If back up heat present, must be electric.
$1,800 rebate for a ductless heat pump for income-qualified customers. Must replace electric resistance as the primary heat source.
$1,000 rebate for a ductless heat pump. Must replace electric resistance as the primary heat source and primary unit must be in the main living space.
Earn a $1,000 rebate for installing solar panels on your home. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn a $1,000 rebate for installing solar panels on your home. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn $500/kWh up to $6,000 for your battery storage system. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Earn $500/kWh up to $6,000 for your battery storage system. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Income-qualified households can earn $1.20/watt up to $7,200 for adding solar panels to your home. An approved solar trade ally must install system.
Income-qualified households can earn $1.00/watt up to $6,000 for adding solar panels to your home. An approved solar trade ally must install system.
Income-qualified households can earn $1,000/kWh up to $13,000 for home solar battery storage. An approved solar trade ally must install the system.
Income-qualified households can earn $750/kWh up to $10,000 for home solar battery storage. An approved solar trade ally must install the system.
Receive $100 off qualifying Google Nest and ecobee Smart Thermostats when you purchase online.
Eligible customers can replace their existing windows with new ones with a U-Value rating between 0.27 and 0.23 and earn $1 per sq ft.
Eligible customers can replace their existing windows with new ones rated U-Value 0.22 or less and earn $1.50 per sq ft.
Earn $0.75 per sq ft for qualifying floor insulation measures in manufactured homes. Income-qualified customers. Must insulate to at least R-22.
$1.25 per sq ft for qualifying floor insulation measures in manufactured homes. Must insulate to at least R-22 or fill the accessible floor cavity.
$0.75 per sq ft for floor insulation measures in qualifying homes. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
$1.00 per sq ft for floor insulation for income-qualified customers. Must insulate to R-30 or greater or fill the accessible floor cavity.
$1.50 per sq ft of wall insulation. Existing wall insulation must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater or fill the accessible cavity.
$2.25 per sq ft of wall insulation for income-qualified customers. Existing wall insulation must be R-4 or less. Must insulate to R-11 or greater.
$1.50 per sq ft of attic insulation for manufactured homes. Income-qualified customers. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less.
$1.25 per sq ft of attic insulation for manufactured homes. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-30 or greater.
$1.50 per sq ft of attic insulation. Income-qualified customers. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-38 or greater.
$1.25 per sq ft of attic insulation. Existing insulation must be R-18 or less. Must insulate to R-38 or greater.
$500 discount on a ductless heat pump with additional heating source. The heat pump must replace zonal electric as the primary heat source.
$250 discount on qualifying heat pump controls.
Up to $500 rebate for qualifying hardwired level 2 chargers, capped at 75% of total costs. Must be installed by a licensed electrician.
Up to $250 rebate for qualifying 240-volt home EV chargers, capped at 75% of total costs. Must be installed by a licensed electrician.
Up to $1,500 rebate for qualifying hardwired level 2 chargers for income-qualified customers.
Up to $500 rebate for qualifying 240-volt home EV chargers for income-qualified customers.
Up to $300 rebate for qualifying standard level 2 charger installations. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.
Up to $1,000 rebate for qualifying standard level 2 chargers for income-qualified customers. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.
Up to $1,000 rebate for a main breaker panel if required to install a level 2 EV charger. Must be at least 200 amps, 30 slots, and 40 circuits.
Up to $5,000 rebate for a main breaker panel if required to install a level 2 EV charger. For income-qualified customers.
$50 rebate for existing Tesla Wall Connector or other Level 2 charger not on the qualified charger list. Must join the PGE Smart Charging Program.
$50 rebate for a qualifying EV charger purchased and installed before it was added to the qualified products list.
Earn up to $25 for enrolling in the Smart Thermostat Program and save $25 on your PGE bill each summer and winter season.
$4,000 incentive for replacing an electric forced-air furnace with a qualifying central ducted system.
$4,000 incentive for installing a ducted heat pump on your home.
$4,000 incentive for installing a ducted heat pump in your manufactured home.
Earn a $1,200 rebate for installing solar panels on your home. Systems must be installed by an approved Energy Trust solar trade ally contractor.
Free home energy audit and weatherization services.
$900 upfront discount on heat pump water heaters through select retailers.
Up to $1,700 upfront discount on heat pump water heaters for income-qualified residents.
$1,000 rebate on a ducted heat pump, with $250 rebate for prescriptive duct sealing.
Up to $6,000 rebate on a ducted heat pump, with $500 rebate for prescriptive duct sealing. For income-qualified residents.
$800 rebate for ductless heat pump.
Up to $4,500 rebate for ductless heat pump for income-qualified residents.
$1.00/sqft of insulation up to 50% of total project cost.
100% of eligible insulation costs for income-qualified residents.
$250 rebate for air sealing, plus $0.10 per square foot of sealed attic or crawl space.
Up to $4/sq ft rebate for high-performance windows or glass patio doors.
Up to $20/sq ft rebate for high-performance windows or glass patio doors, for income-qualified residents.
$40 rebate per appliance for qualifying clothes dryers and washers.
Up to $600 for heat pump water heaters, up to 50% of water heater cost.
Up to $1,000 for ducted or ductless qualifying heat pump systems.
Up to $125 for a smart thermostat.
Qualified low-income members who have permanently installed electric heat may qualify for free weatherization.
Up to $2,000 for heating equipment measures such as replacement parts, efficiency measures, and smart thermostats. Must use delivered fuel oil.
Up to $3,200 for heating equipment measures such as replacement parts, efficiency measures, and smart thermostats. Income-qualified residents only.
Up to $1,000 for duct sealing and insulation measures for income-qualified residents.
Up to $600 for duct sealing and insulation measures.
Up to $4,500 for dwelling insulation measures ($1,500 per region of the home) for income-qualified residents.
Up to $3,000 for dwelling insulation measures ($1,000 per region of the home).
Up to $1,500 for energy-efficient windows and doors, for income-qualified residents.
Up to $1,000 for energy-efficient windows and doors.
$900 upfront rebate for a heat pump water heater. Must replace an existing electric water heater.
Free Google Nest smart thermostat for residential customers with electric forced-air furnaces or heat pumps.
$400 upfront rebate on a residential electric vehicle charger.
$6/square foot for energy-efficient windows and patio doors, up to 50% of project cost.
$32 rebate per exterior door, up to 50% of project cost. Primary heat source must be electric.
Up to $2/sqft rebate for insulation, depending on existing and final insulation as well as location (attic, floor, walls). Up to 50% of project cost.
Up to $50 rebate for an electric clothes dryer or washer.
Up to $140 rebate for a smart thermostat for residential customers with electric forced-air furnaces or heat pumps. Cannot exceed 100% of the cost.
Up to $1,100 rebate for a heat pump water heater, not to exceed 100% of project cost.
$200 rebate on a residential electric vehicle charger.
Up to $1,200 for a new air source heat pump that meets efficiency requirements. Only homes with existing electric forced air furnaces qualify.
$800 for a new ductless air source heat pump that meets efficiency requirements. Existing heat source must be electric.
$3,500 rebate for a ductless heat pump replacing electric forced air as the primary heat source. Primary unit must be in the main living space.
$2,900 rebate for a ductless heat pump replacing electric zonal heating as the primary heat source. Primary unit must be in the main living space.
$3,500 rebate for a ductless heat pump replacing electric resistance heat in manufactured homes. Primary unit must be in the main living space.
$2,000 rebate for a heat pump for income-qualified customers. Applies to single-family and manufactured homes, townhouses, and buildings to 4 units.
$1,000 rebate for a ductless heat pump. Must replace electric resistance as the primary heat source and installed in the main living space.
Up to $300/kW rebate for installed home solar systems, not to exceed 50% of project cost.
$500 rebate for a ChargePoint Home Flex electric vehicle charger.
Free energy audit, which is required for other Ashland incentive programs.
Up to $900 rebate for a ducted air source heat pump.
Up to $1,200 rebate for a ductless air source heat pump, depending on fuel switching.
Up to $300 rebate for duct sealing where pre-existing heat source is electric.
Up to $600 rebate for a qualified heat pump water heater, tier 3 or higher.
Up to $200 rebate for an induction cooktop or range, depending on fuel switching.
$50 for an Energy Star certified electric clothes dryer.
Up to $8 per square foot rebate for energy-efficient windows, depending on u-value.
Up to $0.66 per square foot rebate for insulation, depending on existing R value and area.
Up to $900 rebate for heat pump water heaters.
Up to $1,200 rebate for an air source heat pump.
$3,000 rebate for a ground source heat pump.
$800 rebate for a ductless air source heat pump.
$300 rebate for heat pump water heater of 55 gallons or less.
Up to $1,100 rebate for a heat pump water heater, not to exceed 70% of product cost.
Up to $1,200 rebate for a ducted air source heat pump, not to exceed 70% of product cost.
Up to $900 rebate for a ductless air source heat pump, not to exceed 70% of product cost. Must have an electric primary heat source.
$900 rebate for qualified tier 3 and tier 4 heat pump water heaters.
Up to $1,000 rebate on a ducted air source heat pump, dependent on existing system.
$800 rebate on a ductless air source heat pump when replacing an electric furnace or zonal electric heat.
$150 upfront rebate for a heat pump water heater, total install cost $550.
Up to $900 for a Unitary heat pump water heater. Tier 3 or 4 only.
Up to $1,200 for a qualified ducted air source heat pump, depending on current heating system.
Up to $800 for a qualified ductless air source heat pump, depending on current heating system.
Up to $1,100 for a heat pump water heater, depending on type and capacity.
$800 for a ductless air source heat pump when switching from electric heating systems.
$1,000 for a qualified ducted air source heat pump when switching from electric heating systems.
Up to $675 for a qualified heat pump water heater, not to exceed 70% of product cost.
Up to $2,400 for a ducted air source heat pump. Homes must have electric heat.
Up to $2,100 for a ductless air source heat pump. Homes must have electric heat.
Up to $2,400 for a ducted air source heat pump. Homes must have electric heat.
